TopicTitle: So, how about Eve's new incline?

Articles.Content: Look for yourself. Go into map view, and check the plains
Is it... inclined after 0.22? Been there a couple of times since 0.22 and never, ever noticed any change...
Wasn't it inclined before 0.22 as well? Oh ma gad. How could I miss that?
Eve has always had an inclination of 2.1 degrees...
Are you talking about the inclination of its orbital plane? Has it been changed from 2.1 degrees?
I think it's changed. It doesn't look like 2.1. Atleast, my protractor doesn't say so.
Has it now changed from 2.1??? I thought that has always been there?

Well, it's always been grueling to get to. You need the dV to incline, get there, and escape the blasted gravity well of 1.28 g's, not to mention landings. Still, i doubt they'd change the angle by only another degree or so; what difference would that make to us? Most of us wouldn't have even noticed.
Well...let's measure the picture. Opposite side is about 0.5 cm on my screen, and the adjacent side is 13 cm... that gives 2.2 degrees.

I also noticed that some of eccentricities of some of the planets seem to have been possibly changed (??) as well?. It seemed that Moho was possibly in a more eccentric orbit and that there was more variation in Kerbal-Duna distances perhaps? All in all, if so, I think it's a great idea. More realistic
I'm pretty sure it was like that since .17... I always remember it having quite an inclination.
I'm pretty sure it's always been like that. It's one of the reasons I always end up at Duna when I was planning to go to Eve.
I never noticed it was on an incline I just go there normally :S
The pic looks more inclined then before...
